result.execSummary:
The defendant Reggie A. Drott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Reggie A. Drott is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Reggie A. Drott was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Reggie A. Drott was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

01:12 PM DA calls cases 16CF13 & 16CF18 and states appearances. Defendant Reggie A. Drott in court with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties acknowledge receipt of revocation packet, and waive its reading. Court states maximum penalties in all cases. Comments and recommendations by DA.  DA certifies Victim Rights Compliance on 15CF10. Comments by Atty Willett. Comments by DE. Exhibit #1 marked and identified and received. Court in recess at 1:57 pm Back on record at 2:16 pm.  Summation by Court. Court imposes on revocation cases. 

15CF10
Ct. 1
1 year and 3 months prison initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision  - 179 days sentence credit 
Reimpose all prior monetary obligations with credit for payments made. 
DE is eligible for the substance abuse program

Ct. 4 
6 months jail - sentence is concurrent to Ct. 1 
Reimpose all prior monetary obligations with credit for payments made.


16CF13
Ct. 1
1 year 3 months prison initial confinement and 2 years 6 months extended supervision - sentence is concurrent to 15CF10 & 16CF13 Ct. 1  - 197 days sentence credit
Reimpose all prior monetary obligations with credit for payments made. 
DE is eligible for the substance abuse program

16CF18

Ct. 1
9 months jail - Sentence is consecutive to 15CF10 & 16CF13  - 179 days sentence credit
Reimpose all prior monetary obligations with credit for payments made. 

Court informs DE of loss of rights as a convicted felon.

Court has completed written determination form

records.addlTxt: DNA Submission Form

11:34 pm - DA calls cases 15CF10, 16CF13, 18, 19, 17CF8 and 17CT21 and states appearances.  Defendant Reggie A. Drott appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Lex states agreement. Court states its position on DNA surcharge.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to all counts.  Court questions DE regarding the plea and plea questionnaire.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty on 15CF10 Cts 1 & 4, 16CF13 Cts 1-3, 16CF18 Ct 1, 17CT21 Ct 1 and orders entry of JOC.  On motion of DA, dismisses the balance of counts, except for 17CF8, which is dismissed but read in for purposes of sentencing on 16CF13. Court imposes:

15CF10 - Ct 1 - Sentence withheld - 2 years probation, cc
Conditions of probation
$268 cc

15CF10 - Ct 2 - Sentence withheld - 2 years probation, cc
Conditions of probation
$268 cc

Restitution to be determined by DA's office within 30 days.

16CF13 - Ct 1  Sentence withheld - 2 years probation, cc
Conditions of probation
$268 cc

16CF13 - Ct 3  Sentence withheld - 1 years probation, cc
Conditions of probation
$243 cc
$438.59 restitution plus 10 % surcharge of $43.86
DE must submit an apology to victim/victims in way and manner to be determined by probation agent.
 
16CF18 Ct 1  Sentence withheld - 2 years probation, cc
Conditions of probation
$300 fine
$250 DNAAS
Submit to AODA assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommendations.

17CT21 Ct 1
$530 fine

Appeal rights given

11:59 am - Back on record on 17CT21.  Same appearances except DE.  Atty Lex purposes 60 days to pay.  Court grants.  If unable to pay in that time, DE may request pay plan which may be  as low as $25 per month or CO.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2017 at 11:30 am.

Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Comments by Atty Lex, who states there is a global agreement.  Comments by DA.  Court grants a continuance.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 14, 2017 at 10:00 am.

10:59 am - DA calls cases 16CF13, 16CF18 and 16CF19 and states appearances. Defendant Reggie A. Drott appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  16CF18 has a motion filed.  Atty Lex moves to withdraw motion.  Granted.  To be set for plea and sentencing.  Bond to continue.
Motion hearing on August 10, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Information filed at last hearing, acknowledged by parties and reading waived.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Bond to continue.

for bond modification

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney. Defendant shall provide the Clerk's office with proof of enrollment in the inpatient treatment program at the Tomah Veteran's facility or report to the Price County Jail or post $1000 cash bond by 03-27-16.

2:46 pm - Plaintiff, District Attorney Mark T Fuhr, in person. Defendant, in person, in custody with Attorney James R. Lex, Jr., in person. Attorney Lex states request for bond modification. Discussion by parties. Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint. Court orders bond modification.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

10:33 am - Judge and Court Reporter appear by telephone.  Plaintiff, District Attorney Mark T. Fuhr, in person. Defendant, in person, in custody with Attorney James R. Lex, Jr for purposes of today's hearing, in person. DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges.  DE next court date is 03-29-16 at 10 am. Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation.  Court order $1000 cash bond. Adj. 10:38 am.
